abstract: United States military, launching new kind of battle against Islamic State, is ordering its Cyber Command to stage computer-network attacks; move displays Pres Obama's intent to use cyberweapons against militant group, which has shown its ability to use modern communications and encyption.
lead_paragraph: The military has been told to mount computer-network attacks against the group, which has proved effective at modern communications and encryption.

headline.main: U.S. Cyberattacks Target ISIS in a New Line of Combat
headline.print_headline: U.S. Unleashes Digital Arsenal in War With ISIS

snippet: The military has been told to mount computer-network attacks against the group, which has proved effective at modern communications and encryption.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
